comments: The formula produces primes for all values of n from 0 through 79.First 80 prime entries are palindromically distributed because a(n) = P(x) = x^2 + x + 41, with x=n-40 and we observe that P(x) generates primes (A005846) for x = 0 through 39, along with the fact that P(-x) = P(x-1). - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Apr 24 2006
references: C. Stanley Ogilvy and John T. Anderson, Excursions in Number Theory, Dover Publications, NY, 1966, p. 37, 147.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,500
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Apr 11 2001
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _Andrew Plewe_, May 16 2007
